text:
Use a URL like: http://host/cgi-bin/logbook.pl
Check the error log. The client causing the error is not included in the error line.
Our security scanner generates lots of these. The lack of client information
makes it very difficult to skip over them when looking for real errors.
creator: gc@bnl.gov

text: Please post the actual error messages you're seeing.
creator: trawick@apache.org

text:
Error line reads:
[Wed Feb 28 15:58:11 2007] [error] /var/www/education/cgi-bin/logbook.pl not
found or unable to stat
creator: gc@bnl.gov

text:
Has anything happened with this report? Do you need additional information? If
so, what?
creator: gc@bnl.gov
jorton@redhat.com
text:
[Fri Oct 19 10:40:30 2007] [error] [client 127.0.0.1] script not found or unable
to stat: /local/root/httpd-2.2.x/cgi-bin/aga

The code looks correct and seems to work as expected here.  Can you reproduce
this with the latest 2.0.x or 2.2.x release?
Works for me, and has been over two years NEEDINFO with no reply from OP.
creator: nick@webthing.com
